verses.text: Josiah \add was\add* eight years old when he began to reign , and he reigned in Jerusalem one and thirty years.

And he did \add that which was\add* right in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and walked in the ways of David his father , and declined \add neither\add* to the right hand , nor to the left. \p

¶ For in the eighth year of his reign , while he was yet young , he began to seek after the God of David his father : and in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from the high places , and the groves , and the carved images , and the molten images.

And they brake down the altars of Baalim in his presence ; and the images , that \add were\add* on high above them , he cut down ; and the groves , and the carved images , and the molten images , he brake in pieces , and made dust \add of them\add*, and strowed \add it\add* upon the graves of them that had sacrificed unto them.\f + \fr 34.4 \ft the images: or, the sun images\f*\f + \fr 34.4 \ft graves: Heb. face of the graves\f*
And he burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars , and cleansed Judah and Jerusalem.
And \add so did he\add* in the cities of Manasseh , and Ephraim , and Simeon , even unto Naphtali , with their mattocks round about.\f + \fr 34.6 \ft mattocks: or, mauls\f*

And when he had broken down the altars and the groves , and had beaten the graven images into powder , and cut down all the idols throughout all the land of Israel , he returned to Jerusalem.\f + \fr 34.7 \ft into…: Heb. to make powder\f* \p

¶ Now in the eighteenth year of his reign , when he had purged the land , and the house , he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah , and Maaseiah the governor of the city , and Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder , to repair the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his God.

And when they came to Hilkiah the high priest , they delivered the money that was brought into the house of God , which the Levites that kept the doors had gathered of the hand of Manasseh and Ephraim , and of all the remnant of Israel , and of all Judah and Benjamin ; and they returned to Jerusalem.

And they put \add it\add* in the hand of the workmen that had the oversight of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and they gave it to the workmen that wrought in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to repair and amend the house :

Even to the artificers and builders gave they \add it\add*, to buy hewn stone , and timber for couplings , and to floor the houses which the kings of Judah had destroyed.\f + \fr 34.11 \ft to floor: or, to rafter\f*

And the men did the work faithfully : and the overseers of them \add were\add* Jahath and Obadiah , the Levites , of the sons of Merari ; and Zechariah and Meshullam , of the sons of the Kohathites , to set \add it\add* forward ; and \add other of\add* the Levites , all that could skill of instruments of musick.

Also \add they were\add* over the bearers of burdens , and \add were\add* overseers of all that wrought the work in any manner of service : and of the Levites \add there were\add* scribes , and officers , and porters. \p

¶ And when they brought out the money that was brought into the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, Hilkiah the priest found a book of the law of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add given\add* by Moses.  +  r 34.14  t by: Heb. by the hand of *
And Hilkiah answered and said to Shaphan the scribe , I have found the book of the law in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. And Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan.

And Shaphan carried the book to the king , and brought the king word back again, saying , All that was committed to thy servants , they do \add it\add*.\f + \fr 34.16 \ft to thy…: Heb. to the hand of, etc\f*

And they have gathered together the money that was found in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and have delivered it into the hand of the overseers , and to the hand of the workmen.\f + \fr 34.17 \ft gathered together: Heb. poured out, or, melted\f*
Then Shaphan the scribe told the king , saying , Hilkiah the priest hath given me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.\f + \fr 34.18 \ft it: Heb. in it\f*
And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the law , that he rent his clothes.

And the king commanded Hilkiah , and Ahikam the son of Shaphan , and Abdon the son of Micah , and Shaphan the scribe , and Asaiah a servant of the king’s , saying ,\f + \fr 34.20 \ft Abdon: or, Achbor\f*

Go , enquire of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* for me, and for them that are left in Israel and in Judah , concerning the words of the book that is found : for great \add is\add* the wrath of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* that is poured out upon us, because our fathers have not kept the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to do after all that is written in this book.

And Hilkiah , and \add they\add* that the king \add had appointed\add*, went to Huldah the prophetess , the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvath , the son of Hasrah , keeper of the wardrobe ; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college :) and they spake to her to that \add effect\add*.\f + \fr 34.22 \ft Hasrah: also called, Harhas\f*\f + \fr 34.22 \ft wardrobe: Heb. garments\f*\f + \fr 34.22 \ft in the college: or, in the school, or, in the second part\f* \p
¶ And she answered them, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , Tell ye the man that sent you to me,

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place , and upon the inhabitants thereof, \add even\add* all the curses that are written in the book which they have read before the king of Judah :

Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods , that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands ; therefore my wrath shall be poured out upon this place , and shall not be quenched.

And as for the king of Judah , who sent you to enquire of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, so shall ye say unto him, Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel \add concerning\add* the words which thou hast heard ;

Because thine heart was tender , and thou didst humble thyself before God , when thou heardest his words against this place , and against the inhabitants thereof, and humbledst thyself before me, and didst rend thy clothes , and weep before me; I have even heard \add thee\add* also, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Behold, I will gather thee to thy fathers , and thou shalt be gathered to thy grave in peace , neither shall thine eyes see all the evil that I will bring upon this place , and upon the inhabitants of the same. So they brought the king word again. \p
¶ Then the king sent and gathered together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.

And the king went up into the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and all the men of Judah , and the inhabitants of Jerusalem , and the priests , and the Levites , and all the people , great and small : and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant that was found in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 34.30  t great…: Heb. from great even to small *

And the king stood in his place , and made a covenant before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to walk after the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and to keep his commandments , and his testimonies , and his statutes , with all his heart , and with all his soul , to perform the words of the covenant which are written in this book.

And he caused all that were present in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand \add to it\add*. And the inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to the covenant of God , the God of their fathers.\f + \fr 34.32 \ft present: Heb. found\f*

And Josiah took away all the abominations out of all the countries that \add pertained\add* to the children of Israel , and made all that were present in Israel to serve , \add even\add* to serve the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* their God. \add And\add* all his days they departed not from following the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the God of their fathers.  +  r 34.33  t present: Heb. found *  +  r 34.33  t from…: Heb. from after *
